name: Time use in Sweden - Statistics Sweden
title: Time use in Sweden - Statistics Sweden
description:
Time spent on activities has been categorised under six main headings: gainful employment, personal needs, housework, leisure, studies, and other activities. The definition for each activity is outlined below:
  • Gainful employment includes time spent at work and time spent commuting to and from work.
  • Personal needs includes meals, personal care, and travel for personal needs.
  • Housework includes cooking, washing, ironing, cleaning, caring for own children, caring for others, maintenance work, purchase of goods and services, other housework, and related travel.
  • Leisure time includes sports and outdoor activities, TV and radio, hobbies, entertainment, cultural, and social activities, other free time, and related travel.
  • Study time includes time spent studying and travel for studies.
For the original data, see Table 1 in the 1990 Sweden Statistics time use report; Table B:4 in the 2000 report; and Table B:1a in the 2010 report.

fields.name: Time allocation, average day, women
fields.description:
Average time spent on a particular activity, by women, on an average day. Estimates take a weighted average of minutes spent on a particular activity on weekdays and on the weekend. 

For example, time spent on leisure on an average day is calculated as: 
Leisure_averageday = (5/7)*Leisure_weekday + (2/7)*Leisure_weekend
